caption: Windows Service Activity
description: Windows Service Activity events report when a process interacts with the Service Control Manager.
name: windows_service_activity

1.caption: Create
1.description: A service is created, for example by calling CreateService. Refer to the win_service attribute for details.

2.caption: Reconfigure
2.description: A service is reconfigured, for example by calling ChangeServiceConfig or ChangeServiceConfig2. Refer to the win_service attribute for details.

3.caption: Start
3.description: A stopped service is started, for example by calling StartService. Refer to the service attribute for details.

4.caption: Stop
4.description: A running or paused service is stopped, for example by calling ControlService or ControlServiceEx. Refer to the win_service attribute for details.

5.caption: Pause
5.description: A running service is paused, for example by calling ControlService or ControlServiceEx. Refer to the win_service attribute for details.

6.caption: Continue
6.description: A paused service is continued, for example by calling ControlService or ControlServiceEx. Refer to the win_service attribute for details.

7.caption: Delete
7.description: A service is deleted, for example by calling DeleteService. Refer to the win_service attribute for details.
